title.narrative: Copenhagen Business School - World 2030 case competition, 2020

description.narrative: Copenhagen Business School - World 2030 case competition, 2020 - Engagement of Danish and Africa university students in the SDGs and the Danish development cooperation.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 1) strengthening the collaboration and reciprocal understanding, between Danish and African university students; 2) providing concrete science-based solutions to social issues, with a local perspective; 3) positive exposure of the MoFA actions about International Development and Cooperation;

actual.value: 1) Feedbacks from participants highlighted the importance of dealing with different mindsets and cultures in achieve common sustainable goals. Students stressed how it has been crucial to be able to put each other shoes to understand limitations and strengths in terms of resources but also in terms of project management cultures and relevance of goals for the respective countries. 2) Deliverables of the projects included a full report with analysis of the current situation, definition of possible solutions, general recommendation on future steps forward. Students cooperatively worked to understand the problem and design a science-based solution that had to fit local requirements in terms of cultural acceptance, local constraints, institutional limitations. 3) Involving local embassies and universities, may be seen as functional to the promotion of the concrete steps and efforts that Denmark is taking to support developing countries, and social sustainability globally. Further exposure
